sentences: Amada "Amy" Galvez Santos-Ocampo De Francesco  (23 June 1925 â€“ 20 December 2009) was a Philippine pianist and composer.
Amada Santos-Ocampo was born in Manila, Philippines, of parents Antonino Santos-Ocampo, Sr., and Juanita Galvez of Manila.
Santos-Ocampo took a position in the Penn State University human kinetics programs where she worked for 24 years and composed music for ballet.
She was one of the first members of the League of Filipino Composers founded in 1955.
